name: Epic PVP: Fantasy
description:
Epic PVP: Fantasy is a head-to-head battling card game. At the start of the game, each player chooses a class deck and a race deck, then shuffles them together to create unique character combinations, such as a Human Paladin or Goblin Druid. Each combination creates unique tactics and strategies to use when you battle.

The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent by reducing them to zero life. Players do this by playing moves that act as both attacks and blocks as well as with special cards and abilities granted by the player's choice of class and race.

During a turn, a player adds cards to their "aggression pile", then chooses how many cards to draw from their aggression pile into their hand. The player uses the aggression provided by the cards that remain in their aggression pile to play move cards to block incoming enemy attacks. If an attack isn't blocked, the player takes damage, specifically one damage per unblocked enemy attack. Then all the moves played by that player become attacks for the opponent to deal with on the opponent's next turn. There's more to it than that, but those are the basics...

name: Gemcutter
description:
You are a gemcutter, a master shaper and collector of rare and beautiful gemstones. You are constantly supplied with gems of all kinds from amber to diamonds. You compete with other gemcutters to amass the most valuable collection of gems.

Each player starts the game with a single random gem and the communal Market starts with three random gems. On a player's turn, he or she draws a random gem from the bag and adds it to his or her store. Then, he or she may add one of his or her gems to the Market to gain extra actions equal to the gem's value. The gems are valued 1-5, in order from least to greatest: amber, jet, emerald, ruby, and diamond. Then, that player takes 1 action (in addition any extra actions gained) in which he or she may: trade a gem with the Market, shape a gem, or add another gem to the Market.

When a player trades in a gem, he or she may take other gems from the Market less than or equal to the traded gem's value plus one. For example, if a ruby (value 4) is traded in, it is worth 5 and may be used to trade for a diamond (value 5), an emerald (value 3) and jet (value 2), and many other combinations based on what is available in the Market.

When a player shapes a gem, he or she places it on any of the three appropriate Shaping Tracks on the player aid. A gem may be Polished, then given a Fancy cut, then a Brilliant cut. A gem cannot be given a Fancy cut until it has been Polished and cannot be given a Brilliant cut until it has been given a Fancy cut. Polished gems are worth twice as many points at the end of the game. Fancy cut gems are worth triple and Brilliant cut gems are worth quadruple their values. However, it takes a number of turns equal to its value to be shaped. For example, an emerald (value 3) takes 3 turns to make an uncut gem into a Polished gem. Therefore, the more the points, the longer it takes to shape it.

When the last gem is taken from the bag, the current player finishes his or her turn and then the game proceeds to scoring. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Office Shark Tank: Don't Get Eaten Alive!
description:
Office work is bad enough but with the addition of office sharks, it's deadly! Start your day at the 9 a.m. starting space and try to avoid being eaten alive by the mechanized hungry office shark. Flick the spinner and depending on what it stops on, you either advance or retreat.  After moving, if you land on one of the "blood spots", it's feeding time! Wind the shark up, set him on the playing board and let him rip! After 3 bites, you're out of the game. If you make it to the end of the day at the 5p.m. finish line, you've made it out of the office alive!

A fun little mini board game to play in the office or at home!

name: Name That...! Person, Place, Thing...
description:
Name That...! Person, Place, Thing... is the quick thinking name game in which 2 or more players, 6 years and older, race to be the first to call out an acceptable answer to the category starting with a given letter. The game consists of a deck of 50 cards, and the object of the game is to finish with the most cards.

To begin play, the deck is shuffled thoroughly and placed face up in a pile on the playing surface. Designate a dealer who will read the categories and starting letters for the first round. The dealer reads aloud the category on the top card and then places it next to the deck to reveal the letter on the next card. Players race to call out an answer to the category starting with the letter revealed on the next card. The first player to call out an acceptable answer wins the first card. In the event of no answer or a tie, the card is set aside and the next winner of a card wins both cards. Play continues until all but the last card has been won. The player with the most cards wins.

Note: This is not the same as Name That...! Person, Place, Thing..., even though it has the same name, and was published in the same year, by the same publisher.

name: Girl's Time
description:
Girl's Time is a 2-5 player bluffing game. The player that gets the most money will win the game.

In this game, there are two customers on the table and they need some goods such as shoes, clothes, etc.  Each player has three cards and on their turn must choose one of three actions:

1. Play cards: You can play up to three cards, face-down, so you can bluff. If somebody think you are bluffing, they may call "check" and reveal all of your cards this turn. If they called your bluff correctly, you must pay them $100 per card, otherwise they pay you $100 per card.

2. Finish a sale: If you think most cards on a customer are correct, you can finish the set and sell them. If most cards are correct, you can earn lots of money. On the other hand, if most cards are incorrect, you have to pay money back to the customer.

3. Change your cards: pay $200, redraw five cards and keep three.

This game is very is to learn and play. In most case, if you want to play correct card, you have to trick the other players because they want to "check" you. If you want to play an incorrect card, you have to trick them to sell the product and lose lots of money. In this game, trickery is the most important thing.

name: Pithecus
description:
Pithecus is a simple close tactical combat game. The players control groups of early primates: Ramapithecus on one side and Australopithecus on the other.

The primates are rated for strength, movement, and morale. Each may take one of four actions (attack, stay, flee, or fight) each turn, but must make a morale check first. There are some simple terrain rules. Wounds and death are recorded by rotating the "counters," which are actually folded paper cubes.

Two maps are provided, each in two sections.

The game was one of Kaylor and Humrichouser's Games With Depth, which all used folded 3D paper pieces.

Note: Ramapithecus is today not regarded as its own genus, and in any case lived millions of years before any of the Australopithecus species.

name: Rum & Bones
description:
Avast ye pirates! Gather your crews and set sail for adventure on the high seas in Rum & Bones!

Based on online MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) style games, Rum & Bones has 2-6 players taking control of legendary pirate heroes, each with unique powers and abilities, as their crews fight over Davy Jones' legendary treasure!

Players will each control up to five heroes at any time, moving them across the game board in an attempt to destroy various key features across their opponents ship. Victory is obtained by destroying enough of these features. Your heroes are not alone, however, as your crew also consists of deckhands and bosuns who, while not controlled by the player, will work on a simple AI to wreak havoc on the enemy!

Of course, what would pirates be without plunder? And in Rum & Bones the most sought after treasure are Davy Jones' mythical pieces of eight! Players will amass these powerful coins during gameplay to unleash devastating abilities and attacks from their Heroes, crushing all enemies before them until only they remain!

name: Wedge-It
description:
Wedge-It is played on a board of forty equilateral triangles arranged in a hexagonal grid. Each player has nine pieces which are equilateral triangles with handles (these are created by cutting and folding provided sheets).

The handle of each piece identifies its front. A piece may move into the space adjacent to its front by rotating around either adjacent vertex. A piece may also jump an opposing piece if its front is adjacent to one of the opposing piece's sides.

The object is to make it impossible for the opponent to move.

This is one of Kaylor and Humrichouser's "Games With Depth," all of which had folded 3D paper pieces.

name: Islamic Jihad: "The Mother of All Surrenders"
description:
Islamic Jihad is a parodic micro-game about the first Gulf War. It can be played by any number of players, each of whom represents an Iraqi Army commander. Each commander has 100 troops and must travel 10 miles (in 1/10 mile increments) in order to surrender to American troops.

Play is entirely driven by die rolls. Each turn players roll on a main table which directs them to roll on one of six other tables, which may require more dice rolls, etc. Eventually each player will find that they move backwards or forwards some number of spaces or lose some number of troops.

name: Secret Weapons of the Third Reich
description:
The date: March 1938. The vast majority of Austrians cheer the Anschluss of their country by the German Reich. Central Europe is falling into Nazi hands and all the best European scientists will soon compete under the aegis of Heinrich Himmler, for whom no scheme is too wild or too improbable — but which team has the imagination, the courage, and the drive to most successfully accomplish their goals?

Secret Weapons of the Third Reich is a game for one to four players simulating the arms race of World War II from the German perspective. From secret submarine bases in Greenland to the mysterious Base 211 in Neuschwabenland, Antarctica, this game recreates the incredible tales of Nazi technology, from the famous V-1 buzz bombs and V-2 rockets to the unlikely flying saucers derived from the work of Nikola Tesla. Will players be able to deliver the Haunebu project to completion? Will Hans Kammler escape with his last battalion of flying saucers to the dark side of the moon? Will the secret submarine fleet sail to Antarctica to pursue the war after the war? Or could German scientists produce an atomic bomb to be dropped on New York by an electro-gravitational flying saucer or within the warhead of a futuristic intercontinental V-3? Would it even be possible to build a huge solar satellite gun to strike America?

In the game, each player controls one or more research groups, each working on a secret weapon project. Each research group has a leading researcher, who provides an initial bonus (expressed in resource cubes or scientist cylinders) when the project is assigned. The researcher has a regime loyalty value that measures both the ability to make requisition attempts and the ability to resist opposing attempts.

A player tries to get their projects approved, then completed. Certain requirements (resource cubes and/or scientist cylinders and technologies attached to projects) must be met and costs paid in order to reach the stage of development of a project. Each turn, approved projects generate specific amounts of resource cubes as funding. Completed projects award victory points (VP) and allow, in most cases, weapon production. Produced weapons award VP to the owning player in addition to helping to achieve a cooperative goal for all players. In fact, if together the players fail to reach a certain number of weapons produced by the end of the game, they all lose. The weapon production goal varies depending on the number of players.

Play begins in 1938, one year before the outbreak of world war. At the start, players can only place research groups for their approved projects (project plants) in the portion of the map representing Germany and Austria. In 1939 and later, the conquests of Nazi Germany allow players to deploy their project plants in occupied European territories — but players will have to pay attention to the various locations because some areas allow only research and development, others only weapon production, and still others only research and development for U-Boat projects.

Also, players must operate in a "state of warfare". This means that as time goes on they are more and more subject to enemy bombardments that can cause a great loss of resources and technologies. In addition, as starting in 1943 Allied and Soviet advances on Berlin make the map progressively smaller, players must face logistical issues never encountered during the early years of the war.

Should a completed project or produced weapon fall into Allied hands, players not only lose VP, but the weapons production goal recedes as well! Thus a certain amount of player cooperation is a must. Each player must balance his personal interests with the common need to share technologies and resources in order to fulfill the common goal.

Last, but not least, via events one player may secretly become the turncoat, working in the shadows to help the enemy, and winning the game if all players would otherwise lose.

name: Cabriole
description:
Cabriole is a medium-weight worker placement, card drafting, and resource management game for 2-4 players aged 13 and up, and playable in 60-90 minutes.

Set in London during the early 1700's, players aim to create the most successful furniture studios by hiring skilled craftsmen such as carvers, joiners, and turners; purchasing raw materials such as wood and silk; and fulfilling customer orders for tables, chairs, and cabinets. Players must balance the need for capital with the importance of increasing their studio's prestige throughout the city. The player who has scored the most prestige points at the end of eight rounds (nine rounds in a three-player game) is declared the winner.

name: Archmagery
description:
Archmagery is a battle of duelling mages, their summoned monsters, dazzling and devastating spells, and powerful magical items, where only the cleverest – or sometimes luckiest – wizard will rise to ultimate power and can claim the title of Archmage!

The aim of the game is to become the most powerful wizard, which can be achieved in a number of ways, from eliminating all your rival wizards, to gaining the Artefacts of Power. Although let’s be honest – killing your opponents to win is much more fun!

Game features include:

    Eight wizards, aligned to the spheres of power: Earth, Air, Fire, Water, Animal, Plant, Acid, and Death.
    A host of monsters from lowly kobolds, skeletons, and gnolls, through to the might of creatures such as the dragon vine, the battle giant, and the iron golem.
    A compendium of spells including those that will transform monsters, steal your opponents’ magic, deflect spells away, bind monsters immobile, strengthen and weaken monsters, and more.
    A hoard of treasures including rings and amulets that grant magical immunity, enchanted horns to summon monsters to battle, magical weapons, powerful arcana to increase spellcasting power, and more.
    Fast and furious game play with battling monsters and spell-slinging as each wizard strives for supremacy.

name: KaBlooey
description:
KaBlooey is a light-hearted party card game that pits player against player in a war for survival. Toss bombs, grenades and even nukes at each other in a bid to be the ultimate victor in this fast-paced game of bluffing and strategy for 3 to 8 players.

The object of KaBlooey is to destroy your opponents’ Bases by blowing the living hell out of them with bombs, grenades, and any weapons you can get your hands on! Each enemy has 3 lives (Bases) and if you’re the last Bomber standing with 1 or more Bases at the end of any turn - you WIN! But, there’s a twist: the cards you play don’t have to be actual bombs! You can bluff your way to military supremacy with a non-Bomb card to try and get your opponents to waste their valuable resources. War is hell, and all’s fair in love and KaBlooey!

name: Det Realistiske Travspill
description:
A roll-and-move game for 2-8 people.
Players agree on how much monney each player gets at the start of the game.

Every player bets on which horse they want to race and then race their horse on the racing-track. If two or more players want to race the same horse, players draw which player gets to race the horse of choice.
Horse 1-4 starts on starting-line 1, and horse 5-8 on starting-line 2. All horses use the same goal-line. As a compensation for starting on starting-line 2, the last four horses get one extra die-roll during the race. The race runs for two rounds around the track.

It's not allowed to pass the horse in front of you in the same track. You have to pass horses by changing the track and pass on the inside or outside. It's only allowed to change track acording to the arrows on the gameboard. So sometimes you'll be blocked from using a good die-roll.

Around the track you'll find spots in diferent colors. Each color have their own special-effect.
Yellow: Double-spot.
Red: Miss the next move, and other horses may pass in the same track (there may be two horses in the red spot).
Green: Double the amount of your next die-roll.
Blue: Use only one die next die-roll.
Black: At the next die-roll, move forward only if getting dice of same value. Unless two-of-a-kind, move backwards in the same track according to the die-roll (you are not limited by other horses behind you).

The first player to pass the goal-line after two rounds wins the race and receives the money in the pot and from each player the same amount of money the winning player put on his horse before the race. Maximum bid on a horse is 500.

name: Around The Horn
description: While watching a baseball game, all players are dealt 7 cards. The remainder of the deck becomes the draw pile. Before each at bat, all players select one card from their hand, trying to predict the outcome of the at bat. Any number of players may select the same card. If the result of the play is a gomer or triple, player that selected that result receive 2 points. Any other result, players that selected a matching result receive 1 point. All cards selected cards are discarded replaces drawn and then next at bat is played. After the game ends the player with the most points wins.

name: Dead Things: The Zombie Boardgame (Third Edition)
description:
The zombies are everywhere, they catch you by surprise and attach when you least expect it. By yourself you might be able to get through the crowd, but it's either all of you or none of you...that was the deal.

In Dead Things, the players need to work together to play against the game. Turn order and movement is controlled by a movement deck and the board is set up so that zombies appear in a programmed order, moving ahead of you if your characters move too slow.

The goal is to find gas, and car keys and leave the board before the zombies overwhelm the party.

Dead Things 3rd Edition is a board game that expands on the original Dead Things game. New maps, new challenges for 1-4 players.

name: Die Kutschfahrt zur Teufelsburg
description:
Die Kutschfahrt zur Teufelsburg is a 3-10 player card game.

Turn actions:

    Trade
    Duel
    Pass
    Declare Victory by naming your team and who has the three items, starting with yourself


If a trade is rejected that is the end of that player's turn.

Duels: Beginning with the player to the attacker's left, players declare their support for attacker or defender in order. Apart from the attacker and defender, players can abstain.

Victory: Declare Victory by naming your team and who has the three items, starting with yourself, then one by one. If you name players on your team incorrectly or they don't have the object(s) you lose.

name: Bonje in de stal

Chaotic reaction game for the whole family.

You have to fill your stables with 1 male animal and at least 1 female animal of the same kind. 
If you have 2 male animals in 1 stable, than you have "trouble in the stable" or in Dutch "Bonje in de stal".

All players flip a card at the same time, grab and play as fast as possible a card of your choice.
Animals you win have to put in your own stable. You can block or empty other stables with elephants, mad cows and crazy horses.
If you have a truck, you can put the animals in other stables.

Can you be the first player who fills 5 stables?

Given to the visitors of Spellenspektakel 2014 in Eindhoven, The Netherlands.

name: Taudelon Station
description:
Taudelon Station is a game that shares elements with traditional card games and modern economy games. Players will use their hands of cards to create resources and currency so they can build various modules. These modules are worth points at the end of the game and they also modify how the game plays as well. A unique aspect to Taudelon Station is that these modifications change the game for all of the players, not just for the players who own the modules.

Players’ hands come from a deck of cards that has five suits, numbered 1 to 9. Players will either play a combination of at least two cards that equal exactly 10 to create a resource (called Elements), or they will play a combination of cards similar to the various types of Poker hands (pair, full house, etc.) to create the currency (called Energy) that works with the resources to let players build the modules.

Meanwhile, unidentified aliens are swarming around the station, and while the game is fully competitive, the players all must defend the station against the aliens or everyone loses.

name: Opération Nez rouge: Le jeu
description:
In Opération Nez rouge: Le jeu, players form teams of two persons: one driver and one passenger. Each team tries to be the first to get home! The passenger shouldn't snooze! Give the right indications to the driver to ensure to come safe! Driver, you'll try to understand what your funny passenger is telling you.

The game is played in successive rounds. The winning team will be the first one to complete three itineraries. One player picks up an itinerary card and will try to give indications by funny words and gesture. The other player (driver) will have to switch cards displayed in front of him to replicate the right itinerary of the objective card.

name: Mulligan's Wild
description:
From the box:

Object of the game: Move all the tees from the tee box to the green. Don't forget this is an exciting, strategy game with lakes, sand traps and obstacles.  So get your golfers together and have fun.

User Description:
Mulligan's Wild is a golf-themed roll-and-move game with a "send your opponent back to the start" mechanic similar to Backgammon or Sorry. Although this game claims to be "Golf game of the year," the golf theme seems entirely pasted on. Players roll dice and try to move their pieces (or "tees") out of their tee box, along the track, to their green and then into their hole.  There is a special "Mulligan's Wild" die included, which allows players to move a number of spaces of their choice. First player to move all tees onto the matching green and into the matching hole wins.

name: Tiki Challenge
description:
"Get ready for adventure as you cross a deep chasm on rickety swinging bridges!  The trail to the tiki is easy to follow if you know how to use blends and digraphs--but watch out for broken boards!"

Tiki Challenge is an educational game to teach children words using blends and digraphs. Players have a series of tiles displaying blends and digraphs. Each player spins a spinner, moves along a track to a space with a partial word, and must use a tile from his/her hand to complete the word. A player who is unable to complete a word must return to the start. The first player to reach the tiki at the end of the track wins.

name: Cadence: Road Racing Championship
description: Cadence is a 2 player biking microgame in which players are professional cycle racers going head to head on a race circuit. Racers use their stamina, shift gears, make use of abilities like 'drafting' and 'sprinting' and strive to reach to the finish line first. The game makes use of unique mechanics like card interlocking, sliding and rotating cards, 3D like vertically folded racer cards to fit a fairly complex but tactical game in just 18 cards. The race is played on a track made up of 6 'track cards' which are either flat sections or climbs and descends of different gradients. Double sided track cards allow for a second more difficult track to be made from the backs of the cards giving replay ability to the game. There are 2 racers to chose from while they each have their own special abilities the other one does not have. You can play a big game of 3 laps or a short filler of 1 lap, so immerse yourself in the world of bike racing, micro style!

name: Flatten out Monsters
description:
Monsters invade! Heroes are ready to defend in groups of two, but these heroes are out of control and need an intelligent leader to lead them to victory. Can you do it?

Flatten out Monsters is a new type of memory game in which you need to memorize only six cards! Can you effectively lead the heroes and flatten out the monsters?

To set up, monster cards are placed in a 3x7 grid and double-sided hero cards are placed in a 3x2 grid in front of the monsters. Heroes in the same line — that is, a line of two hero cards — will fight the seven monsters lined in front of them. On a player's turn, he must swap two hero cards, then flip them to the reverse sides. These two cards activate the cards in the same line with them and become the attacking groups, then you resolve the attack on the monsters one by one in each activated line. If the two hero cards show the icons needed to defeat the first monster in line, they win the fight and score the monster card. Then they fight against the second monster, and so on until they fail. Play continues in clockwise order until at least two lines of monsters are all defeated, and whoever has the most monster cards wins!

name: Micro Train
description:
It is your job to help connect coaches to the train. You are not only responsible for adding coaches of the colour assigned to you, but to also complete the train as quickly as possible.

A short train building game for two, consisting of only 19 cards.  The winner of the game is the person with the most valuable coach segment in the color they are responsible for. Train coaches are worth different points based on their class, and coaches can only be added to coaches on the train if they have the same class or colour, where first class passenger coaches cannot be added directly to third class coaches, and vice versa.

Players face a simple choice on each turn: Take a train coach card in their hand, or add a coach coach from their hand to the train. But beware - coaches not placed at the end of the game counts against your score.

name: Flowering Snail
description:
Flowering Snail is a refreshing abstract game that challenges players to plan ahead over the two stages of the game! Players compete against each other by increasing their snail population. You need to place your snail cards and flower cards wisely to claim the delicious flowers (for the snails, of course), and maintain your snail population to score the most points!

The game is played in two phases: Multiplication and Die Out phases. In the Multiplication phase, players alternates to place their Snail cards (with values 1 to 3) onto the game board adjacent to other snails already there. As an additional action, they may also place one Flower card onto the game board. After all Snail and Flower cards are placed, players check who controls each Flower cards by adding the values on their Snail cards. The higher sum may take the adjacent Flower card as scores.

In Die Out phase, players alternate to remove Snails cards from the game board if the chosen Snail card has a lower value than all the other adjacent Snail cards, until no more Snail cards can be removed. Each remaining Snail card scores the printed value for its owner, and each Flower cards worths 2 VP. The player with higher VP wins the games.

Castles and Keeps is a 2 player head to head card laying game using a deck of only 9 cards.

Players take turns to place a card matching the castle type and at the same time trying to cover their opponents shields with their own.

Once all cards have been placed, players with three or more castles connected by a road score one point for each.

As soon as a player gets to 30 points they are crowned the champion.

Castles and Keeps is a free print and play game.

name: Race to the North Pole
description:
Ahoy, adventurer! The Arctic is merciless: Your expedition team has to endure the unforgiving wilderness, the unexpected weather and the other fame hungry teams. Only one will be remembered as the conqueror of the North Pole. If you think you can adapt the ever-changing harsh conditions better than the others, start gearing up — the race is on!

In Race to the North Pole each player has an expedition team which they have to navigate to the North Pole on the middle of the game board. The first player to get all of his or her pawns there wins the game. Game is played by moving with cards that are in front of you. Some cards allow movement while others also ambushing other players. But ambushing has a price! When ever you tackle another player you have to grab an "Ice Mask Tile", which include equipment and some nasty hazards that might ruin your well planned schemes.

Race to the North Pole also features a unique rotating board that simulates the Arctic weather. When a storm hits the board, everything changes! Your movement cards travel on the board and you receive a new set, the arctic maze that is formed out of cracks changes completely and the players travel around the board with the weather. This design has deep strategical elements that make every playthrough exciting and challenging to the very end.

The game includes a free app Dized that gives players loads of new content, localizations, and mechanisms to use with the game through their smart devices.

name: It's a Cinch
description:
Described by the publisher as a "multiplication and division poker game," It's a Cinch is an educational game designed to teach multiplication tables. Three stacks of poker-style chips with answers to multiplication tables printed on them are placed in the center of the table. Each player is dealt five cards with single-digit numbers. Each player in turn tries to find two cards in their hand that can be multiplied to match the total on one of the three top chips. The player then captures that chip, discards the two played cards, and draws two new cards. They player may then try to capture another chip (up to three per turn). When the player reaches three chips or cannot capture another chip, play passes to the next player.  If a player makes a mistake and plays the wrong cards to capture a chip, the player must put both that chip and one previously-captured chip on the bottom of one stack and pass his turn. After all the chips are claimed, the player with the most chips wins.

There are a couple of variants which add extra rules, as well as a solitaire version.

name: Corrupted Kingdoms
description:
Corrupted Kingdoms is a fun strategy and negotiation game set in a fantasy world, where you take on the role of an evil corporate monster, fighting for power over the pathetic united kingdoms and its political elite. To advance your hidden agenda, and enrich the lives of your friends and associates, you will use your horde of minions to corrupt and subvert the assembly of the realm. Use the right kinds of "persuasion", increase your own power, and push backroom deals through the assembly, all while looting the kingdom and its people of all its worth.

At the start of the game, each player will choose a fantasy corporation to play as (Dragons, Sorcerers, Giants, Witches, Vampires or Orcs), a Hidden Agenda which will guide their evil plan, and some starting minions (Zombies, Demons, Goblins, or Golems).

Over the course of the game players will influence the assembly of the realm (Humans, Elves, Dwarves, and Gnomes) using their minions and influence. Propose bills through lobbying efforts, buy useless and pretty luxuries, and get the politicians who represent the (ahem) "people" to push their nefarious legislation into law.

name: Quizmo Vocabulary
description: Educational game of bingo to teach antonyms and synonyms.  Cards are laid out just like a bingo game (5 x 5 grid), but the "free" space is labeled either as "antonyms" or "synonyms".  The rest of the spaces are words.  The game leader pick a word from the 121-calling card deck and call it out.  Those players with "antonym" on their free space will cover any word that is an antonym of the called word.  Those players with "synonym" on their free space will cover any word that is a synonym of the called word.  Any player who covers 5 spaces in one row of their card - either vertically, horizontally or diagonally, will call out "Quizmo!".  They are the winner of that game.

name: De Schout van Lokeren
description: Against the background of the history of the City of Lokeren (a city in Flanders, Belgium) players try to acquire local products (pigs, hares, hats, linseed, corn, turnips) and sell them on the market. With profits made on the market players can construct buildings or improve their modes of transport (cart, horse and cart, truck). In the meantime players can obtain title deeds and chance cards which are worth victory points. The one with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

name: D. Afonso Henriques
description:
D. Afonso Henriques is a game about the first King of Portugal. During the game, each player will follow the King through several villages in order to recruit the best army. When in battle, each player will use it’s army to fight and defeat the Moors and hence contribute to the victory of the Portuguese.

The players recruit the armies when D. Afonso Henriques meeple is in a circle over a small village in the Portugal’s map. Respecting order of play, each player chooses the village he wants to go, in the villages area in the board, and places his cylinder in the available symbol.

Players can enter a battle when D. Afonso Henriques meeple is in the circles marked as battle. In it’s turn, the player chooses one or more Portuguese cards from his hand to enter the fight. He places his chosen card(s) face up in the battle field, in one of the 4 spots available, in front of the Moors card that he wants to fight with. Each Portuguese card indicates in it’s lower side the number of dice that the player is allowed to roll. If a Player uses 2 cards, he can roll the total dices resulting from the 2 cards. Each Moors card has in it’s upper right corner a die with a value. If the highest result of any dice rolled by a player matches or is superior to this value, the player wins the fight and the Moors card is defeated.

The game ends after the battle of Ourique (the 5th battle). The player with more Victory Points wins the game.

name: Jumpy
description: Turn the card and try to locate the right animal character on the game board - if there is one! You receive a card for each victory and the player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Twinny
description: Find the same picture on two different cards and mark them with your token. The player who collects the most cards this way wins the game.

name: Bugsy
description:
Roll the dice to find out your animal colour combination, and try to find it among the tiles which are spread on the table. Once you find your tile, mark it for yourself and move closer to victory. The winner is the one who first is able to place all of his markers.
Contains three different game versions. A fun game to test the speed of the players' reactions. Comes with great, colourful game parts.

name: Joepspel
description:
This is a smart pack of cards that includes multiple games in one. Each card shows a number, with different symbols and colours to denote how that number can be achieved. For example, the card for 18 shows a red heart (the game's symbol for 2) and a yellow cat (the symbol for 9), a red and yellow pattern, and eighteen dots arranged in a 2x9 grid.

New games playable with the pack appear regularly on the website. The base game is a game that helps to learn multiplication tables while playing the game.

name: Kul genom Sverige
description:
Travel through Sweden to become the first to reach the goal, and thereby win the game.
But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). And if you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards - this is the same as an orange, but more random.

An exciting drive through Sweden, with a lot of local informations. Family game - also for the little ones.

name: Sjov Gennem Danmark
description:
Travel through Denmark to become the first to reach the goal and thereby be declared the winner.
But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards, which is random and unforseen; it could be good - but it could also be bad!.

An exciting drive through Denmark. Family game also for the little ones.

name: As Tears Go By: Operation Starlite
description:
As Tears Go By: Operation Starlite is an introductory level game on the battles of US Marines and the NLF in I Corps of Vietnam in August of 1965.

The Battles of Operation Starlite were the first large-scale fights waged by the Marine Corps in Vietnam. A spy informed the South Vietnamese I Corps commander that an attack on the US Marine Base at Chu Lai by the NLF’s (National Liberation Front) 1st Regiment was imminent. The Marine’s commander, Lt. General Lewis W. Walt convinced his superiors that the best defense was a pre-emptive attack. He also decided against informing or working with his South Vietnamese counterpart, as past intelligence leaks led to the elusive Viet Cong disappearing in the face of the American’s probes and attacks.

Operation Starlite depended upon the coordination of amphibious landed troops of the Marine’s 3/3 Battalion while those of the 1/7 marched from the north to serve as the “anvil”. The “hammer blows” would be delivered by artillery, air and naval support strikes, as well as the 2/4 battalion that would be airlifted into battle. It was hoped that surrounding the VC with multiple threats would trap and force them to do battle.

name: Smash Up: Pretty Pretty Smash Up
description:
Think only pirates, time travelers, vampires and bears can smash bases? Well, get ready to be taught a lesson — in the nicest way possible!

Pretty Pretty Smash Up brings the sweetest factions ever to the vicious fight for victory! Kitty Cats use their incredible cuteness to take control of enemy minions. Princesses ply their royalty, beauty and even their love to get their way. Fairies' fickle tricks give you options like never before, while the herds of Mythic Horses work together for dominance. Get ready — your opponents will never know what hit them!

Pretty Pretty Smash Up can be played on its own as a two-player game or combined with other Smash Up titles to allow for up to four players to compete at the same time.

Integrates with:


    Smash Up

name: The Belongers
description:
Once upon a time there were two villages--alike in every way-- nestled in a land surrounded by fog. It was obvious to each that the other did not belong...

The Belongers is a 2-player semi-abstract strategy game, played without a board, wherein each player tries to raze the opposing village to win.

The game is set up by arranging the hexagonal terrain tiles in one of the map configurations available in the rulebook (or a custom map created by the players).

On their turn, each player takes two of the three possible actions: draft a terrain tile to the map, draft a unit, or move and/or attack with a unit.

Additionally, each unit may use its special ability AND terrain bonus once per turn. Each of the units has a unique special ability, and each of the terrains offers a unique bonus...creating huge number of possible combinations for players to explore as they maneuver around the map, attack enemies (either directly, or by pushing them into hostile terrains), and finally, destroying the opposing castle.

A deep strategy war game that plays any small flat surface.

Includes both the base and reinforcement decks in a single package, as well as the basic and advanced rules.

name: The Autumn War
description:
A cooperative game set in the aftermath of the War of Oak and Pine.

In The Autumn War, players each assume the role of a member of the Oak Kingdom or Pine Kingdom or a member of the outcast Walnut tribe. Players work together to reveal map locations, hoping to find the bodies of loved ones they lost in the recent battle.  Along the way, they must overcome hazardous terrain, inclement weather, and insidious creatures.

Players will need to rely on each other, as well as their ability to find useful items and safe locations to protect them from harm and to survive through the night.

Can you find your lost loved ones and put them to rest before they turn into Lonely Ghosts?

name: Whoya?
description:
Whoya? is the one and only party game that’s all about you. You make the game, you play the game, and you become famous. Whoya? is a fun, hilarious way to get to know all about the people you are with and for them to get to know all about you!

Every round there is a judge that reads the prompt on a Whoya? card out loud. All other players write their response down and turn it in. The reader then selects his or her favorite response, and tries to guess who submitted that response. If the judge guesses correctly, the judge keeps the Whoya? card and earns the point for that round. If the judge guesses incorrectly, the player who submitted the judge's favorite response gets the Whoya? card and earns the point for that round.

Many of the prompts on the Whoya? cards are crowd-sourced from users who have submitted card ideas. On these cards, the first name, last initial, and location that person is from is displayed in the bottom right hand corner of the card.

name: Six Days Campaign: 1814
description:
Covering the 1814 campaign in a half sized magazine game.
This game uses the same simplified card-driven system as Shinshu's Suppression from the same designer.

The map covers the Eastern France from Sedan to Paris.
The 110 counters includes leaders, strength points and markers.
The game uses only 16 cards.

The victory is basically determined by moral of each force. If one side's moral drops to zero, he instantly loses the game.
Coalition player wins the game by eliminating Napoleon or controling Paris, he also must take a number of important cities each turn.

Issue game of Command Magazine Japan #119.

name: Fox Trott': La Guerre des Oeufs
description: Protect your chicken coop by throwing eggs at the fox. If you hit him, he moves closer to your opponent's coop. When the fox reaches one of the coops(the far right or the far left end), the player loses a point. The player who first loses 5 points loses the game.

name: Culica
description:
Culica is a collection of 5 games all played with the same equipment. The game components consist of a 3 inch cube which has a 3 by 3 array of holes in each face, a set of pegs (which fit in the cube holes) of 4 different colours and a black bag.

Along with the normal meaning of adjacent, pegs are considered adjacent even if round the corner on an adjacent face.

The following are the rules to one of these games, "CuColours"
14 pegs of each colour are put in the bag. On their turn players draw one cube from the bag and place it in a legal hole on the cube if possible. Pegs may only be placed if adjacent to at least one other peg and no peg may adjacent to a peg of the same colour as that peg. The winner is the player who placed most pegs.
The other games are CuMolecula, CuSnakes, CuMatch and CuCombat.

name: Faraway
description:
English description:

Have you ever dreamed of being a child again? To see again the world as if it were a game to your service? To play... we are some famous dragon slayers ... in the playground. To forget everything that is not funny and focus only dream about your friends? What the gray world we live hides a multitude of colors? So Faraway is for you.

Faraway is a narrative card game, in which players have to tell stories mixing reality and fantasy, as if to return to their child age. A narrative experience in a group, in which all players participate and contribute to an adventure in which everyone has fun: a collective experience of creation.

Relying on a evocative and elegant illustrations, let's have fun showing many skills: brainstorm, displayed as good storyteller, propose suggestive outcomes, even master the rules and intricacies if yours is the competition. Faraway is a narrative experience for creative, an opportunity to reunite the family, a stimulating way to learn, Faraway is making dreams come true.

The game takes place over several chapters (depending on number of players), usually 6 to the basic game. In chapters, players will have to play cards in their hand in secret, the narrator will take all the cards, shuffle them and reveal. The other players have to vote the letter they deem best represents the next scene (not being able to vote their own). The owners of the two most voted letters, earn a point and make a proposal to continue the story narration. The other players will vote which of these two proposals is the best. The winner will get another point and will be the new narrator.
The same procedure in all chapters.
At the end of the game, the winner is he who has the most points.


Spanish description:

¿Alguna vez has soñado con volver a ser un niño? ¿A volver a ver el mundo como si fuera un juego a tu servicio? ¿A jugar a que tú y tus compañeros sois unos famosos cazadores de dragones... en el patio del recreo? ¿A olvidar todo lo que no sea divertido y centrarte sólo en soñar con tus amigos? ¿A que el mundo gris en el que vivimos esconde un sinfín de colores? Entonces, Faraway es para ti.

Faraway es un juego narrativo de cartas, en el que los jugadores tienen que contar historias mezclando realidad y fantasía, como si volvieran a tener cinco años. Una experiencia narrativa en grupo, en la que todos los jugadores participan y contribuyen a crear una aventura en la que todos se diviertan: una experiencia colectiva de creación.

Apoyándonos en unas evocadoras y cuidadas ilustraciones, vamos a divertirnos demostrando muchas habilidades: aportar ideas, mostrarse como buen narrador, proponer desenlaces sugerentes, incluso dominar las reglas y entresijos si lo tuyo es la competición. Faraway es una experiencia narrativa para los creativos, una oportunidad de reunir a la familia, una estimulante forma de aprender, Faraway es hacer realidad los sueños.

name: Pop City
description:
The object of the game is to end up on your colored circle in POP CITY ESTATES with the most money or win automatically by being the first person to reach the POT-O-GOLD.

Players start with $2,500 each.  Using two dice die the players make their way around the board through the 8 Soda Towns buying properties as the go.

name: Obsessive Cartographer
description:
Obsessive Cartographer is a solitaire game for the Tiledeck.

Setup

     Shuffle the tiles face-down.
     Draw one tile and place it face-up on the table.


Overview
You just woke up in a dark room (represented by the tile on the table). You see one to four doorways (spots at the edges of the tile) leading out of the room. This suggests you are in a mappable location. You are obsessed with mapping, and of course have your cartography tools with you. Choose a direction to explore, and try to map all 60 rooms!

Goal
Map the darkness!

Play

     On each turn, choose a doorway to walk through (anywhere on your budding map).
     Draw a room (tile), and place it face-up adjacent to that doorway, such that a doorway on the new tile matches with the one through which you just walked. If there are any other adjacent rooms, their doorways or walls must match: You can never have a doorway up against a wall!


Game End

     If the room you drew can’t legally fit, you have discovered that you have made a cartographic error, and you go into fits thinking about how you can fix your map!  You lose consciousness, and while you lie on the floor, your mind carefully blocks out the whole experience.
     If, however, you place the 60th room legally, you are quite pleased with yourself, pack up your new completed map, and take a nap.  While you sleep, something gives you a mighty whack on the head and eats your map; you won’t remember any of this when you wake.

name: In a World of Dinosaurs
description:
In a World of Dinosaurs is a territory and resource collection game for 2-4 players where you play simultaneously as Paleontologists in the present, and Dinosaurs in the past, on two separate boards. One board represents the island millions of years ago, and the other represents the island around the early 1900’s 
Players defend their land from opposing teams, expand their territory, and explore the jungle for artifacts, all the while strategically fossilizing dinosaurs in areas of the island they control.

As they kill off these dinosaurs, players assemble their fossilized remains, and send them off to the museum to start attracting visitors. Sure, they may be narrowly avoiding certain death while they do so, but who isn’t?

The better the dinosaurs, the more visitors walk into your museum. The dinosaurs can be assembled in any combination (for example Tyran-dactyl), to immediately attract visitors, or players can hold out to assemble matching parts for more points.

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
description:
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

In this game, each player fields one of the superhero teams, with each hero — Rocket Raccoon, Groot, Captain Marvel, Daredevil, Kang and more — being represented by custom-tooled dice; each team must be composed of 15 dice, and a player can "purchase" dice only from his team. Each hero also has one or more character reference cards, which show the special abilities for the characters based on the die rolls. Different versions of these cards will be available in booster packs, allowing for more customization of your team. Players use these dice to collect energy, recruit new heroes, and battle head-to-head. In addition, each player brings two basic action cards to the game, which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase these cards. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

The Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron starter set comes with 44 custom dice, 38 cards, two dice bags, and a core rulebook. Booster packs include two dice with two matching character cards.

name: Star Wars Galactic Dice Game
description:
In this Star Wars dice game, take your points for the roll, or push your luck to score even higher to win and gain the Force.

Includes six six-sided dice emblazoned with iconic images from Star Wars in a re-sealable tube.

The rules are similar to Farkle in that three-of-a-kind gets you 100 times the value (R2-D2 = 2, C-3P0 = 3, Stormtrooper = 4, Yoda = 5, Boba Fett = 6, Darth Vader = 10).  You also get points for single rolls of Darth Vader (100 points) or Yoda (50 points).  If you set aside some scoring dice, you can re-roll the others, but if you ever roll without any scoring dice, Jabba takes your points.  However, if you score all six dice, then the Force is strong with you, and you can re-roll all six if you want to press-your-luck.  The first person to score 5,000 points wins.

name: Le Sultan du Feu
description:
Le Sultan du Feu is a solitaire game simulating the campaign of the Egyptian expedition from July 1798 to September 1801 Directoire required by the Directoire and led by General Bonaparte.

In this game, a map in two parts (2xA3) is the historical area of this campaign: the Upper and Lower Egypt, Palestine and Syria, from the Mediterranean to the Red Sea. 1 cm is about 25km and 1 round of game three months in real time.

A game is played in 10 rounds, the time you have to conquer Egypt and face your enemies, Mamelukes, Turks and English who oppose you vehemently.

name: With All Do Respect: The Party Game With An Adventure
description:
With All Do Respect is the first ever party board game with a realistic adventure to it!

Just imagine asking your friends and family any question you want without getting into trouble!

That's right! You can't get into trouble because you said "With All Do Respect!"

THE STORY LINE:

Tonight you and all your friends are going downtown for an exciting night out but tomorrow you have to get up early for work or school.

The object of the game is to move around town stopping at different locations to collect party points and then be the first player to make it back home.

You collect party points by answering fun questions about each other or anyone you decide is lucky enough to be on your Vip List.

You also collect party points by singing at the Karaoke Club, dancing with all your friends at the Night Club, telling jokes and making up new rules to follow at the Comedy Club, gambling on all your favorite games at the Casino or stopping by the Tattoo Parlor to draw fun pictures of your friends, famous celebrities and much, much more!

Along the way try avoiding the police because you could get arrested for driving suspiciously and have to spend time in Crook County Jail!

The first player to collect 12 party points and make it back home - Wins The Game!

name: Q-bitz Solo
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Use Q-bitz Solo as a solitaire challenge or to add another player, a new color and additional pattern cards to the original Q-bitz game. This personal-sized version of our best-selling game includes 20 new pattern cards, a wooden tray, 16 cubes and instructions, all packed in a travel-friendly tin box."

name: Housing Crisis
description:
Housing Crisis is a light two-player strategy game where you assume the role of overwhelmed real estate brokers trying to place lodgers into a new suburban development without wasting any housing space or upsetting them by cramming too many into one plot.

Tokens are drawn at random from each players private store so that two are always to hand and ready to be placed, which keeps the luck/skill balance well proportioned. Additionally, as the token values are fixed for each player, as the game progresses and the board starts to fill, it becomes easier to guess what the other player might be holding, increasing the chance for a strategic play.

Players take turns placing game tokens (representing the daily clients calling into the office) onto the shared game board, housing them as effectively as possible within the parameters of the rules. The winner is the agent with the most points after each player has placed all their tokens down.

name: Hoppers: Chinese Vampire Action Adventure Game
description:
What are Hoppers? Hoppers are Chinese vampires (a.k.a. Jiangshi). Unlike the blood-craving vampires of Western myth that turn into flying bats, Chinese vampires do not transform and their bodies become stiff. The only way for them to travel is to hop and that’s why they are called hoppers (well, that’s why I call them that).

Hoppers is a 4 to 9-player action/dexterity party game for all ages. In the game, players are guardians of the realm and each holds a power stone that gives them the ability to travel into the Mystic Forest. Player must beware, however, because one of the players may be a demon in disguise and hold the evil Hopper Stone.

Each game of Hoppers is played over the course of up to five rounds. In each round, players attempt to pass a dexterity challenge in the Mystic Forest and only successful players can examine the stones of power. When a player’s matching power stone is found, the player has the ability to capture the Hopper Stone and win the game. Otherwise, the game ends in the Hopper’s Way and all guardians disappear into the dark of the Mystic Forest.

name: Monsters vs. Heroes: Victorian Nightmares
description:
Heroes and monsters fight to death in the streets of victorian London!

Each player take a secret faction card, that will say if he is at the side of the "Heroes" or at the side of "Monsters".

During the game, a player can either play a card from his hand or draw a new card. Each card will give you "black" points (if you are a Monster) or "white" points (if you are a Hero). Also, each card represents a character with a special skill that you can use in your favor. Dracula can control the forces of darkness. Van Helsing can destroy the undead. Frankenstein's monster can run havoc. Arsene Lupin can steal a card from another player. Jekyll and Hyde discard each other...

The game ends when the last card is drawn. Then, each player reveals his faction and count his points. There can be only one winner!

Monsters vs. Heroes: Victorian Nightmares — first released as London After Midnight — is very easy to learn and very fun to play. There is a total of 18 different characters, in a deck of 30 cards. Some of these characters are unique and deadly, like the werewolf, but others are more common and less powerful, like the brave young men. In addition to this, each faction card will give you an extra point if you have a certain character in front of you at the end of the game. That means that some cards are more useful for some players than for others.

•••

¡Héroes y monstruos combaten a muerte en las calles del Londres victoriano!

Cada jugador coge una carta de facción secreta, que dirá si está del lado de los "Héroes" o de los "Monstruos".

Durante la partida, un jugador puede, o bien jugar una carta desde su mano, o bien robar una nueva carta. Cada carta proporciona puntos negros (si estás del lado de los monstruos) o blancos (si estás del lado de los héroes). Además, cada una de estas cartas representa a un personaje con una habilidad especial que puedes usar en tu beneficio. Drácula puede controlar las fuerzas de la oscuridad. Van Helsing puede destruir a los no-muertos. El monstruo de Frankenstein puede provocar el caos. Arsene Lupin puede robar una carta a otro jugador. Jekyll y Hyde se descartan mutuamente...

El juego termina cuando se roba la última carta del mazo. Entonces, cada jugador revela su carta de facción y cuenta los puntos. ¡Sólo puede haber un ganador!

"London after midnight" es muy fácil de aprender y muy divertido de jugar. Contiene 18 personajes distintos, en un mazo con un total de 30 cartas. Algunos de estos personajes son únicos y letales, como el hombre lobo, mientras que otros son más comunes y menos poderosos, como los jóvenes aguerridos. Además, cada carta de facción te dará un punto extra si tienes a cierto personaje frente a ti al final del juego. Esto significa que algunas cartas son más útiles para unos jugadores que para otros.

Tendrás que engañar, jugar de forma estratégica y traicionar a tus amigos. ¡¡Si te gustan los juegos de cartas rápidos y las películas de terror antiguas, "London after midnight" está hecho para ti!!

From the back of the box:

This is the game about the Stena Sphere. You buy, sell, swap and build Stena's various business areas to win. You will also meet unforeseen events on your way towards honour, success and fame. By using good businessmanship, timing and some luck - hopefully you will end up as a winner! read the rules carefully. No cheating and let the game about Stena begin!

The hotels and houses of Monopoly are replaced by Head Offices and Offices respectively.

name: Archer: Fast and Loose
description:
Archer: Fast and Loose is a free print-and-play card game of insults, getting the upper hand, unfortunate phrasing and "sploosh" based on the hit TV show Archer.

Each game round is comprised of two phases: the ISIS Phase and the Missions Phase.  In the ISIS Phase, players secretly choose a room in the ISIS intelligence agency building to move to, with each room conferring a different bonus to the players located there.  During the Missions Phase, players vie to get placed on and then succeed at their preferred mission, with each mission requiring different skill sets, such as Smarts, Guns, Booze and even Sex!

Each player also has a deck of Agent cards characterising one of the main personalities from the show, with different wacky and zany take-that effects for each: have players shout "woo-hoo!" when they join a mission due to Cheryl's "Boarding Party", or have the Sterling player play with his fingers in his ears thanks to his cruel mistress, Tinnitus.

Through succeeding at missions and playing cards, players can gain Sploosh, and the player with the most Sploosh at the end of the game wins!

name: Don't Drop the Meatballs
description:
Don't Drop the Meatballs is a novel take on Jenga or Kerplunk. Players pull game pieces from a clump of game bits, trying not to cause an accident.

On your turn, carefully pull out a strand of spaghetti, but don't let any meatballs roll off! It gets harder and harder to do and if one rolls off the table, the player that did it is out of the game. The last person left, wins! For 2 to 4 players.

Contents: Table top, table base, 20 strands of spaghetti, 5 meatballs, rules

name: Stalingrad: Gorod Smerti
description:
Stalingrad: Gorod Smerti (City of Death) is a regiment to brigade/division level boardgame.

.5mi/.67km per hex scale. 11 weekly turns, 4Sep-19Nov42. Odds CRT with Disruption.  Mass or pinpoint Luftwaffe bombing. East bank Russian artillery. Snipers:  Zaitsev, Fritz, Kulikov, Thorwald, and Tanya Chernova. Engineer battalions vs. bloody exchanges.

name: Medicine Whoops
description:
A game of hilarious medical disasters. Players each take on the role of doctors at a poorly supplied hospital. Doctors compete with each other to treat patients using whatever tools they are able to acquire. Players also have the ability to hinder their fellow doctors in the middle of surgery or just agree to play a round of golf while the patient expires. Patients will begin to stack up fast... both cured and killed. Add em up at the end to determine who among you is the best doctor under the worst conditions imaginable.

Players start with a handful of tools which they quickly put to use when the first patient is revealed. Once the patient is flipped doctors must quickly determine if they can attempt the surgery using the tools they have in their hand.

During surgery other doctors can attempt to hinder the procedure by playing whoops cards which can increase the cost of surgery or steal tools or patients right out from under you.

The length of the game is variable depending on how many patients you want to attempt to treat. This is determined at the beginning of the game. After the last patient has been cured or killed the game is over and doctors count up their living patients subtract the ones in the morgue and arrive at a final score.

name: Limbo
description:
After another day in the life of the young child, it's time to go to sleep. But he doesn't even imagines the existence of two mystical beings in his mind, feeding on your emotions while sleeping. One feeds on their dreams while the other feeds precisely the opposite, and therefore seeks to guide the child to the shadowy world of the most ominous and terrifying nightmares. What happens inside the confused and innocent child's mind? Only the battle between these two fantastic endless decide this. Unwary are those who think they are not plagued by such entities, they barely know that life is only a dream and we only puppets...

Limbo is a board game for 2-4 players, based on the universe created by Neil Gaiman. Players face each other for 8 rounds (the 8 hours of the child sleep), trying to influence the movement of the child in main board. For that, they should put their cards on individual boards, forming combinations of runes, skills and summoning creatures to chase the little one. Players actions must be scheduled, and the cards and creatures can be positioned in future rounds, creating a system that must be planned and thinking beyond the present moment.

name: Minimize
description:
Minimize is a game that seems to yield some fierce tactics despite being extremely simple. You could even play with Xs and Os.

You almost always want to play your opponent's color, trying to build small "territories" that you can create tiny groups in. Beginners should definitely start out on the base 5 grid and slowly work their way up to larger boards.

The rules are explained here: http://www.scribd.com/doc/260002289/Minimize

It should be mentioned that it seems to work on square grids as well, and some people even prefer it that way.

name: Heaven and Hell Toroidal Checkers
description:
This is a checkers variant using an 8x8 board that is viewed as a torus: column A is adjacent to column H and row 1 is adjacent to row 8. Thus, for example, a piece on 1.a3 can move to h4.

GOAL: to be the only player with pieces on the dark squares (called "heaven," light squares are called "hell.")

SET UP: starting position is for a standard game, 12 pieces per side, moving one space forward diagonally, obligatory captures. Kings are made whenever a friendly piece is landed on, and move forward or backward per the norm.

GOING TO HELL (or back to Heaven): when an enemy piece is jumped over, it is moved to the left (of the jumping player) to the nearest empty or friendly occupied  square in the same row. If landing on a friendly piece it becomes a king. If there are no such spaces left in a row the jumped piece is removed from the game. Movement rules on light squares are the same for dark.

name: Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game
description:
Set in a post-apocalyptic sci-fi setting, Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game is a hybrid game that combines the elements of a strategy board game, with card building and role-playing. It is driven by macabre stories of a world gone mad and features adventure, politics and economics to deliver an unlimited sandbox experience. Each game the variables change: cards, player interactions, stories, strategies and threats. While the game has a strong pulp influence, its roots stem from Cold War studies. We have expanded upon this research to arrive at our game’s premise: What would happen after a nuclear and biological apocalypse?

Our answer is Fallen Land. As a player, you are the leader of a unique faction of survivors competing for primacy in the ruinous aftermath of post-apocalyptic America. You must manage and enhance your town, protect your citizens and secure resources. You will also have to make and break treaties to endure, amidst a myriad of bribery and betrayal by the other players. But that is just where the adventure begins! You must also direct your agents (a party of characters), to explore the rugged landscape, establish your territory and solidify your agenda.

Game play is comprised of Turns. Each represents one month and is divided into Phases and Sub-Phases. The First Player resolves each Phase and Sub-Phase followed clockwise by the other players, before proceeding to the next Phase or Sub-Phase. A Turn is over when all players have had the opportunity to act or pass on each Phase.

I. Effects Phase *
    1.) Resolve.

II. Town Business Phase *
    1.) Deal.
    2.) Resource Production.
    3.) Auction House.
    4.) Roll 1d10 on Town Events Chart.
    5.) Financial period.
        ~Sell.
        ~Purchase.
        ~Hire (NPCMs).

III. Party Exploits Phase *
    1.) NPCMs move.
    2.) Choose Party Exploits (4 weeks to spend).    
        ~Movement, spend 1 week.
        ~Encounter, spend 1 week.
        ~PVP, spend 1 week.
        ~Resource, spend 2 weeks.
        ~Healing, spend 2 weeks.
        ~Mission, spend 3 weeks.

IV. End Turn Phase *
    1.) Adjust Turn Marker.
    2.) Pass the First Player Sheet.


    Resolve an Action Card in each Phase or Sub-Phase as directed by the card.


A player's town is simulated by a Town Play Mat. Players organize their owned Resources, inventory, Party Characters, excess Characters and movement bonuses here. In addition, Town Play Mats can be upgraded three different ways: Town Defense Chips, Town Technologies and Action Cards. The first two upgrades are available for purchase during the Town Business Phase. However, Action Cards are dealt at the beginning of each Turn and are also drawn as a reward.

    Players also manage their Party consisting of five Character Cards. Characters may be equipped with gear (Spoils Cards), to increase their Base Skills. A party can move around the map, draw Encounter and Mission cards (stories) which contain Skill Checks (challenges) and even attack another player's Party in PVP. Dice are rolled for these many "deeds" to determine the outcome. 
 There are seven decks of cards. These are drawn and played throughout the game. Some are stories, such as Encounter and Mission Cards, Characters are a Faction's agents, and Spoils are equipment/vehicle/gear. Lastly, Action Cards modify the story and/or game play.

To win, one of two Victory Conditions is necessary, either 20 Prestige or 80 Town Health. Prestige represents your reputation as a leader, while Town Health represents your town’s prosperity and number of its citizens. Both conditions are marked on their respective Victory Tracks bordering the map.

Adventure and intrigue await!  We hope you have the opportunity to play Fallen Land and that you enjoy playing it as much as we have enjoyed creating it for you.

name: The Mage Codex
description:
The Mage Codex is a cutthroat game of aggressive deck-building and fluid combat set in a fantasy universe.  Your goal is to eliminate all other players by emptying their draw deck.

The objective of the game is to defeat your opponents by eliminating their draw decks.

There are two primary stages to the game: Gather and Battle.

During the gather stage, all players get a chance to draft the cards they want to use into their deck.

The battle stage is all about aggressive deck building, where all the card you want are either stolen from your enemy or you must sacrifice your own life to acquire them.  You will take turns to draw cards (possibly from your opponents sources), then play cards to attack opponents, steal their cards, and protect your own decks.

Will you be the last mage standing?

name: Stone Garden

When meditating by one's garden, virtue points are earned that can be spent on favorite rocks to elevate the garden further. Through famous garden architects from history, special effects affecting the garden can be achieved.

name: Letter Tycoon
description:
Letter Tycoon is the word game for 2-5 capitalists!

In the game, players take turns forming a word using a seven-card hand and a three-card community card pool, scoring money and stock rewards based on their word. Players may use their earned money to buy one letter "patent" in the word they make. In the future, whenever another player uses one of your owned letters on their turn, you earn money from the bank. Letters that are used less frequently have special abilities, increasing their power.

When enough of the alphabet has been claimed, players finish the current turn, then score all money, stock and letter patents owned. Create the most valuable empire and you can become the letter tycoon!

name: Vanquish
description:
The Earth is a dead husk. Having mined all of its resources, facing a population many times that which could be possibly sustained and slowly mutating it into a massive, cloying, choking city, we had no choice but to set our greedy eyes on the planets around us and conquer new lands.

After the Information War of the 21st century, the Corporations dissolved national borders and began a new war of their own: the Resource War. Like their European ancestors, who conquered and fought over new land, the corporations started to clash for control of the stars around Earth, as if they had claims to them from the moment of their conception.

Thus began the new arms race, but this time the lessons learned from past wars would be embraced and used to leverage as much advantage as possible. Research into more advanced abilities to control not only the battles, but the hearts and minds of the people who fight them would become key to victory.
Vanquish is a game of intergalactic warfare amongst rival corporations in Earth’s dark future with a near endless number of system configurations and multiple paths to victory – through the council, through research of technologies and advanced abilities, via the creation of popular utopian worlds, or by the might of your powerful fleets.

Each player steps into the powerful and all encompassing shoes of the head of one of the five corporations fighting for the control of the universe. You will need to use cunning, guile, diplomacy, deception, and tactical thinking to make the decisions that will hopefully bring victory, control, renown, and respect to your corporation.

In each round of the game, players select four actions to perform. Players in turn perform one of these. Whenever an action is performed, all other players may also perform that action. The available actions are: Fleet (move ships), Research (develop tech), Council (Create votes on new rules), Planetary (develop your civilization), Energy (generate resources) and Logistics (build new ships). Players score points for colonizing worlds, developing tech, building colonies, passing votes and developing their civilization. The game ends when one player has accumulated 15 points, but that player does not necessarily win, as there are bonus points scored for being the best player in each of several categories.

name: Star Wars: Rebel Missions Game
description:
Set in the Star Wars cartoon time line, Star Wars: Rebel Missions is a cooperative game for 6 to 12 year olds.

Team up with your fellow Rebels in daring missions to uncover the Imperial Codes in pulse-pounding race against the clock! The electronic audio device plays an epic and ominous soundtrack as players move stealthily between the Imperial installations, using dice and card powers to sabotage their factories and thwart their plans. Evade the evil Inquisitor and disrupt the Empire before time runs out to win!

PROMOTES: 
Cooperation and teamwork
Strategic thinking

name: B-17 Bomber Squadron: A Solitaire Game of the WWII Daylight Bombing Campaign over Europe.
description:
B-17 Bomber Squadron'  is a Game where you are a Commander of a Squadron of B-17 Flying Fortresses stationed in England during World War II. Your Goal is to manage your aircraft and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Daylight Bombing Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (12 Missions), Moderate (18 Missions), or Long (24 Missions).

GAME FEATURES: B-17 Bomber Squadron is a low to moderate complexity level game. Aircraft include the B-17F and B-17G Models, P-47 Thunderbolt and P-51 Mustang Fighter Escort Aircraft. Enemy Aircraft include the ME-109, FW-190, ME-262 and ME-110.

B-17 Bomber Squadron captures the key aspects of the B-17 Daylight Bombing Raids in a fast, fun and easy manner. There are rules for Crew Quality Upgrades, Drop Tanks for Fighter Escort, and dozens of Targets.

NOTICE: B-17 BOMBER SQUADRON is no longer available for purchase as it has been acquired for Publishing! See BIG NEWS Forum below for details.'

name: Supersystem (4th Edition)

SuperSystem 4th edition updates the world’s most comprehensive and versatile super skirmish game with a fresh new look that includes expanded attributes, new and revised powers, improved mechanics that speed play and allow for easier character design, and a new solo-play option!

Built to work with SuperFigs or any other brand of Super miniatures (in 28mm or 15mm scale), SuperSystem provides a flexible setting and campaign rules that will allow players to further develop stories and characters with each scenario played.

name: Portal
description: Portal is a victory point based game in which you use cards to drive the movements and actions of your pieces on the game board.

name: Contact
description:
User Summary:

Contact is a 30 minute social game for 4-16 friendly players. It focuses on physical contact between participants; testing imagination, communication, and intuition—An ice breaker meant to challenge social boundaries.

Players gather in a circle and take turns interacting with new partners.  Each pair finds a way to make physical contact that hasn't already been done in the game. If they succeed, they each earn 1 point.

Each player receives a quirk card that tells them one way they must behave during the game (e.g. "Avoid Eye Contact").  If you can guess a person's quirk, you received a point, and they get a new quirk.

The game ends when everyone has partnered with everyone else once.  The person with the most points wins.

NOTE: This was game was a submission to the Golden Cobra Challenge 2014.  However, it is much more of a social/party/ice-breaker game than a role-playing game, and has been added as such to BGG with the permission of the designer.  The rules for the game are available on the Golden Cobra Challenge website.

name: Space Slugs
description:
In route back to your home planet, following a very successful planetary invasion, your spaceship crashes, leaving seventy slugs stranded on a desolate moon.

There is one option for survival - the only functioning escape pod!

In SPACE SLUGS each player takes on the role of a Slug Officer, and are tasked with recruiting a crew of 5 different slugs to activate the escape pod and flee the desolate moon.

Problem is, there is only one escape pod, so the officer that is able to form his crew first, will be able to activate the escape pod and flee, leaving everyone else to an uncertain future.

The game is played clockwise around a table with players either playing slugs cards from their hands, into play, as their needed crew members. Or playing action cards, which allow them to swap slugs around from player to player, make players lose their turns, or even remove slugs completely from the table.

Play continues until a player has, in play, each of the 5 different slug cards. At which time that player promptly wins!

"Quick, silly, and with just enough challenge ... Space Slugs delivers and won’t disappoint." - FATHER GEEK
